item.description:
The goal of the game is to get one's bug one time around the game board. The first to achive this, wins the game. But beware the maid Fifi! She prowls the game board and shots off the legs of the bugs. Also, whenever two bugs meet, the arriving bug bites one leg off the other bug. The Bugs can only move when they have all six legs attached. To attach a lost leg, they have to roll a 1 or 6. The game is played with 2 dice. The red one determines the movement (clockwise) of the bugs, while the blue one moves the maid counterclockwise.

The game was most likely published in the 1930s.

name.value: Angry Birds: Star Wars – Jenga Bespin Battle Game

item.description:
This is another game based on the popular angry birds app. This is a Target exclusive game that includes a Han Solo bird, Boba Fett pig, Stormtrooper pig, Millennium Falcon launcher, 8 full jenga blocks, and 3 half blocks.

This is designed for 1-2 players age 8 and up.

One player builds the structure and the other player launches his bird attempting to knock down the pigs and the entire structure. This player keeps count of the number of shots taken. Once the entire structure has been knocked down the roles are reversed.

The winner is the player that required the fewest number of shots to destroy the structure.

A game of questions, mainly based on Switzerland. Composed of 400 questions it covers a wide spectrum including, for example, the Vienna meeting of 1815, Facebook, or Swiss heroes.

Points are earned for every good answer and are showing your IQ. The player with the most IQ wins.

Castle Assault is a unique gaming experience combining the ferocious onslaught of Tower Defense games with the strategic elements of CCGs and progressive advancement of RPG's. Castle Assault seeks to break the mold of traditional card games and organically extracts the most enjoyable parts of these different genres and distill them into a standalone concept. Castle Assault plays in about 30 mins, and is for 1 or 2 Players.

Each Player controls a Castle on either side of the Battlefield with 10 Health and a Hero outside of the Battlefield. Players play Units from their hand to the gameboard and these Units physically move toward the opposing Castle based on the Abilities of that Unit and your choices with the intent to bring your opponent from 10 to 0 Health. Should you destroy your opponents Castle or destroy their Hero you win!

"More details please" - a Battle Card Game with tons of combat and strategy. Card combat is fast and furious; every time two opposing Units touch each other in the same column, they Engage in combat (which is often), and can happen either during the Move Units step or during the Open Phase by Charging or using an Ability described on your Units. Combat is resolved immediately with Unit cards exchanging their combat values at the same time (with no luck involved). Should either Unit have a higher attack number then the Armor + Health of the opposing Unit, that Unit is destroyed. Should a Unit smash the opposing Castle without a defending unit, that Unit attacks the opposing Castle directly lowering that Castles Health by the Unit's attack value.

Your Hero grants some bonuses throughout the game and you can even join the Battlefield to turn the tide, however should your Hero be destroyed you immediately lose the game. As you progress through the 1-Player Campaign and complete feats or heroism you can level up and customize your Hero based on the way YOU play. 
 Every deck is also customizable meaning your Unit selection can be optimized before battle, but note this is not a 'pay-to-play' type game. You receive all the cards from all warbands including the 1-Player warband in the Core Edition (NO BOOSTERS).

Most Units have Abilities to; keep them alive, move more quickly, laterally move, resurrect, summon allies, surprise, dissipate, and damage the opposing Castle from afar. You may feign attacks, play Commands to make your Heroes more powerful in a myriad of methods to tactically breakdown your opponent.

The 1-Player Campaign provides a "Right-Outta-the-Box Experience" with 9 Scenarios culminating in a final boss showdown. 1-Player mode operates by Monsters auto-populating in the opposing Castle with your victory condition changing every Scenario including outright smashing the opposing Castle, destroying a boss overlord, or surviving the onslaught. With 9 Scenarios per 6 warbands it creates 54 different challenges (9 campaigns x 6 warbands = 54 games).

link.value: Castle Assault: Dagger of Ill Omen Promo Card
Castle Assault: Halting Force Promo Card
Castle Assault: Sir Mitchell Greencastle Promo Card

item.description:
Players have to build a city in honor of Cesar.

This game has a little of San Juan and Citadels combined.

There are 2 kinds of cards: characters and buildings. Each building card has a cost, victory points, military power, politic influence and sowing capability.

At the beginning of each round players must chose a character with a mechanic very similar to Citadels. Some characters allow building, getting cards, stealing from other players, obtain victory points, etc.

In Phase 2 is the construction phase where you have to 
a) Characters are activated in order. 
b) Draw 2 cards
c) Harvest what your building gives you
d) Build and/or use the power of your character. To pay for a construction players must pay with cards in their hands (a la San Juan)

At the end of the game they will earn points for their edifications, military power and politic influence, and add them to the points gain during the game. The player with the most points will be the winner.

item.description:
Greetings, and welcome to the Slime Hunters Guild! It is our job to venture out into the wilds, track down those pesky creatures known as Slimes, and trap them in a manner that allows them to be brought back alive (alchemists, wizards, pet stores...surprisingly, there are many potential and wealthy buyers.)

Today, there appears to be an outbreak of them, which makes a great business opportunity for us! Take these "magic boxes" with you (the dice), and throw them in order to activate their trapping mechanisms. Should they result in the right symbols (roll the correct result), then they shall be baited correctly in order to attract and trap whatever Slime inhabits the area. Can you bring back a higher valued Bounty than the other hunters?

Contents:


 4 Dice for trapping Slimes
 32 Slime Cards 
 2 Instruction Cards
 2 Score Reference Cards
 1 Box


Gameplay Summary:

Each turn, 4 Slime Cards are drawn and placed in front of the active player. The active player must roll a certain number on the dice in order to trap one or more of them, depending on the colors drawn. If the player is unsatisfied with their dice roll, they may remove one of their dice in order to reroll all of the remaining dice and trap a higher number of slimes for the turn. Gameplay and turns continue this way until the Slime deck is completely gone through twice, then the players reference the Score Reference Card to figure up their scores and determine the winner.

Scoring:

Each Slime is worth 1 point on its own, but additional points bonuses are awarded when certain criteria are met, such as collecting 1 of each color or the most of a specific color.

Chanakya's Chakkravyuh is a unique learning tool in the form of a financial board game. Its main purpose is to help players from all walks of life (including common man, entrepreneurs, corporate professionals, students, educators, home makers, investors) attain financial literacy. Minimum age is 15 years and above.

Inspired by the 2000-year old wisdom of prominent Indian economist Chanakya, this game enlightens individuals on how to manage money and connect financial knowledge to resourceful opportunities, which are ever-present in today's changing world.

The player initially chooses a dream out of various dreams listed on the board. Each dream has a purchase price listed on it. In order to win the game, the player must purchase his/her pre-selected dream.

There are two parts in the game, the first is Chakkravyuh and second is Rajmarg. All players start inside the Chakkravyuh. In the first part of the game, a player may not have enough money to buy his/her dream. Chanakya's Chakkravyuh simulates real-life investment opportunities, various market scenarios, and unforeseen life situations to throw challenges that the participants have to tackle. By successfully navigating these challenges and deriving "passive income" (income where each rupee works to bring you even more rupees), participants eventually build enough income generating assets to move into the second part of the game, i.e. the Rajmarg. It is in the Rajmarg that the player can acquire their pre-selected "dream".

Even though there is no official time limit, the entire game normally lasts about 4 hours. The first player to purchase his/her dream wins the game, and that is officially the end of the game.

The experiential nature of a game-based environment makes the process of learning a lot more fun, and there is also a sense of competition among the participants.

Besides gaining financial knowledge and learning how to leverage passive income, participants will understand the real difference between an asset and a liability. Additionally, important lessons will be learned in basic accounting principles, debt financing, interpersonal communication, negotiations and joint deal-making.

No background in business or finance is required. Absolutely anyone can play this game.

The idea of this game is based on the many videos about cats chasing little race cars on slot-race-tracks.

Children are taking different roles each turn: 
- The Race driver has to puzzle together race cars in different colors pictured on cardboard tiles. Everytime he does he has to say: "Wrooom!"
- The child playing the car has to roll the cat die as often and fast as possible. Everytime he rolls a cat-face he has to say "Meowww"
- The race coordinator is moving the pieces (race car and cat) on the board. If the cat catches the car or the car reaches the STOP-sign he has to say "Stooop!"

There are variants in the game that make it more challanging:
- Secondary attribute: Race cars puzzled together do have to have the same color. In this variant the secondary attribute (color of stripes & Helmets) has to fit, too.
- The second side of the game board features obstacles (looping, jump) that need special sounds.

The game ends when the first car finishes one round.

item.description:
Gib Gas! is a card game in the new "Carrera Tabletop Games" series by Austrian publisher Stadlbauer.

Each round all players select one hand card face-down to set the speed for the current track section. The cards are revealed simultaneously. The player with the "best fitting" speed wins the track section (= VP). Players that have played the same speed collide and cannot win that track section.

If players collide they have to move down with a marker on their card representing the status of their race-car.

Special cards like "Hold Speed" (copy value of last card), "Pitstop" (take played cards to the hand) and "Roll Die" (extremely slow or very fast) expand the possibilities.

The game ends ...
... when the stack of track sections is empty
... when one car is destroyed
The players with the most VP (on cards plus the status of the own car) wins. A player who has destroyed his car cannot win.

name.value: The Transvaal Ablaze: A Solitaire Game of the Boer Wars in South Africa

item.description:
This game is a semi-historical simulation of the Boer Rebellions in South Africa during the later part of the Victorian Era. The Game begins shortly after the Boers declare independence from Great Britain. The Boers have gathered Forces and are poised to launch assaults on several British Settlements in order to drive them out or force them into capitulation. It is the Player's task, as Commander of forces in South Africa, to squash these annoying rebellions and teach these uppity farmers a lesson.

OBJECTIVE: As the Commander of British Forces in South Africa, you must protect the British Settlements put down this rebellion by capturing their Capital of Pretoria before the Campaign Deck runs out.

GAME FEATURES: The game features a fun and simplistic method for resolving solitaire combat tactically, rules for Heroes that can make an impact on the outcome of battles, and lots of colorful game counters. It even includes rules for a potential Zulu uprising.

The Transvaal Ablaze can be found at http://www.berserkergames.net/.

name.value: Aces of Valor: Aerial Combat during WWI

item.description:
ACES OF VALOR is a solitaire Game where the Player assumes the role of a Squadron Commander in charge of 10 aircraft on the Western Front during World War I.

Your Goal is to manage your Aircraft in order to Complete a Campaign, consisting of a series of Missions, and score enough Victory Points (VP) to assist the war efforts.

Campaigns may be Short (8 Missions), Moderate (12 Missions), or Long (16 Missions). The Player determines the length of Campaign to be played.

VPs are earned by destroying enemy aircraft and ground targets. You lose VPs by losing aircraft and failing to complete missions. The Player moves his/her Squadron Flight Counter on the Battlefield Map, however, combat is resolved easily off-map using an Inititiative Track. If you enjoy movies like "The Blue Max" or "Aces High", this game is for you.

Missions include Patrols, Trench Strafings, Recon, Photo Recon, Artillery Observation, Balloon Busting, and Bomber Escort. Rules provide means for Pilot improvement and the choice to fly for the Germans or British.

Most Games usually take 2-4 Hours to print out and assemble, depending on the number of counters, Cards and Mapsheets.

Optional Rules to play as the Lafayette Escadrille using Nieuport 11, Nieuport 17 and Spad VII Aircraft Counters.

Aces of Valor can be found at http://www.berserkergames.net

name.value: The Khyber Ablaze: Uprisings and Punitive Expeditions on the North-West Frontier

item.description:
The Khyber Ablaze places the Player in command of the British Forces along the North-West Frontier and Afghanistan in the later part of the Victorian Era. You must use the forces available to you to put down a wave of uprisings, led by a fantatical Leader, that threaten to throw the British out of the region. If you liked movies like "Gunga Din", "The Brigand of Kandahar", "Flame over India" and "Lives of the Bengal Lancers", this game is for you.

OBJECTIVE: As the Commander of British Forces along the North-West Frontier, the Player must protect the British Settlements and defeat the Khan’s Forces by capturing three of their four Fortified Settlements of Samagan, Konduz, Herat and Kandahar before time runs out or the Khan’s Forces capture enough British Settlements to drive you Back to India.

GAME FEATURES: The game features a fun and simplistic method for resolving solitaire combat tactically, rules for Heroes that can make an impact on the outcome of battles, and lots of colorful game counters.

A rettenthetetlen Csipet Csapat barátaik segítségére indul. Segíts nekik megkeresni és visszahozni Å‘ket a RendÅ‘rség épületébe. De vigyázz! Az ellenség is résen van...

Az eredeti használati utasítás nincs meg. A játékot a repülÅ‘darabok összegyÅ±jtésével kezdjük. Ha megvan mind a négy, akkor már repülve közlekedhetünk a házak között. Meg kell találni a hiányzó karaktereket és vissza kell vinni Å‘ket a RendÅ‘rség épületébe.


Braveheart Rescue Rangers are on way to help their friends. Help find and bring them back to the police station. But beware! The enemy is on guard ...

The original manual is missing. First you have to collect all parts of a plane. After collected all you can flight through houses. You have to find and keep the missing characters until you can bring them back to the police station.

This game is Language Level 1.

name.value: The Sudan Ablaze: Rebellions and Uprisings in the Sudan

item.description:
THE SUDAN ABLAZE is semi-historical simulation of the Mahdi Uprisings in the Sudan during the later stage of the Victorian Era. As the Commander of British Forces in the Egypt and the Sudan, you must protect the British Settlements and squash the swelling fanatical Sudanese forces.

OBJECTIVE: As the Commander of British Forces in the Egypt and the Sudan, the Player must use his forces to protect the British Settlements and squash the Forces of the Mahdi by capturing their Capital at El Obeid in South-Western Sudan before the Campaign Deck runs out.

GAME FEATURES: The game features a fun and simplistic method for resolving solitaire combat tactically, rules for Heroes that can make an impact on the outcome of battles, and lots of colorful game counters. If you enjoy movies like "The Four Feathers", "Khartoum" or "The Light that Failed", you will enjoy this game.

name.value: The Wilderness Ablaze: A Solitaire Game of the French and Indian War

item.description:
The Wilderness Ablaze is a semi-historical simulation of the French and Indian War in the American Colonies during the Mid-1700s. Players assume the role of the Commander of Forces in the American Colonies in the turbulent times where both France and Britain are seeking to increase their nation's territory and power. Can you defeat the French by capturing Montreal and preventing them from capturing British settlements?

OBJECTIVE: As the Commander of British Forces in the American Colonies, you must protect the British Settlements and attempt to capture the Key French Settlements of Quebec, Montreal and Toronto before the Campaign Deck runs out.

GAME FEATURES: The game features a fun and simplistic method for resolving solitaire combat tactically, rules for Heroes that can make an impact on the outcome of battles, and lots of colorful game counters. If you enjoy movies like "Last of the Mohicans", "Pathfinder" or "The Northwest Passage", you will enjoy this game.

The Antares Galaxy System is a merging inter-planetary commerce system, however, not all is blissful and peaceful in the Antares System. One Planet, Xanthar, has grown particularly powerful under the oppressive leadership of a power-hungry, ruthless and brutal ruler, T’arNak! Meanwhile, you and the other players are Free Merchant Traders, buying commodities from a Planet with a large supply and selling them to Planets in need. Now, it is getting a bit tricky and dangerous as T’arNak’s Star Legions are increasing their presence and enforcing their strict trade regulations. The citizens of the Antares System need brave, heroes like you to help them throw off the yoke of T’arNak’s oppression.

The goal of the Players, is to gain the most Star Credits (SC) before the end of the 20th Round. The Player with the most Credits is the winner. In addition, the Heroes will undertake various missions to thwart T’arNak’s operations. The game automatically ends when the first Hero successfully completes 10 of these “Special” missions. If playing solo, the goal is to survive and gain 10,000 Credits or complete 10 Special Missions.

You can find Galactic Smugglers at the following URL:
http://www.berserkergames.net

name.value: Heroes of Valdor: A Board Game of Fantasy Adventure

item.description:
HEROES OF VALDOR is a fantasy adventure board game where the players assume the roles of Heroic Characters in the savage world of Valdor, a place where three races (Human, Elf and Dwarf) have lived and fought for millennia with only a few scattered decades where peace was declared between the races. Now in the east, an invasion is occurring; an invasion by an evil and foul race of Orcs along with their minions of Goblins, Trolls, and a variety of terrifying creatures, led by their powerful and terrifying Sorcerer Overlord by the name of Valtigorn.

It is up to the Heroes to help unite the various races and tribes of Valdor in order to gather enough forces to defeat the Army of Valtigorn.

HEROES OF VALDOR, also, features the amazing Artwork of the extremely talented Mr. Devin Night.

HEROES OF VALDOR is a rich and encompassing Fantasy game that will emerge the Players into Magical and Fantasic World.

Be the first gaining 20 question cards
A simple trivia game played on a map of the German island of Sylt. Movement is decided by a die. There are four categories of questions:
A = General knowledge
K = Culture
W = Economic
P = Politics and History
Obviously, all the 250 questions in the game have some connection to Sylt.

notes: game was published in cooperation with shz (Schleswig-Holsteinischer Zeitungsverlag)

name.value: Board with Life: The Metagame (The Microgame)

item.description:
Board With Life: The Metagame (The Microgame) is a 2-5 player card game representing a single game being played by the Board With Life crew. Each of the 5 main characters is represented by a suit/color, and each has an identical set of 5 action cards, with corresponding power that will help that character win the (fictional) game in question:

- Eliminate (1) - removes another card from the game
- Defend (2) - protects previously played cards
- Swap (3) - swaps cards between players
- Strategize (4) - adds to the power of any other card
- Gloat (5) - does nothing really, but has the most power

The game begins with a quick draft so each player can develop their own strategy, but each turn of the game consists of a player playing a single card. You execute its action, and the card remains in front of you as power towards winning that character. Players are vying to have the highest total power in each character, but player with the highest only scores points equal to the power his opponents control. And since there are five different characters, there are five opportunities to score, so players want to have the highest strength in each character, but only by a slight margin and in as many characters as you can for maximum points.

A library-themed spin on the popular Cards Against Humanity.

To begin, each player is dealt 10 white cards, and one player (the judge) begins the game by flipping over the first black card. The other players then put down one white card each that fill in the blank on the black card. The judge then decides which submission they think is funniest. The player who submitted the winning card gets to keep the black card.

The game is free to print and share online.


Cards Against Librarianship by Emily Lloyd is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 4.0 International License.

In boxes, six containers of ten "box" cards will be sold one by one. The player who bids the highest gets the entire container. The game ends when all six containers have been sold.

To start, one player takes the auctioneer's token, which gives him the right to choose the type of auction (open or secret), then to be the first person to look at the cards in the lot. The token rotates clockwise from player to player with each new turn. Each player in turn gets actions that he has to use in one go to discreetly inspect box cards. Once each player has used his actions, the auction takes place.

Once the six containers (all sixty box cards) have been sold, each player counts his wealth (remaining banknotes + value of the box cards). For each set he holds, a player receives a bonus of 250 ECU. Whoever has the most wealth wins.

item.description: In this game you try to be the first player to complete your 6-piece puzzle. The die shows you which puzzle piece you can take from the table – if it fits in your puzzle, you get to keep it!

Rebuild your castle before dragons block your way
 - acting/moving by turns -

A storm has destroyed Drago-Tuku's castle, the only place where inhabitants get shelter against the island dragons; the knights have to search for the 9 shattered parts before the dragons overwhelm you/them.

Each player moves forward according to the die roll and pick up a part if the move ends on a missing piece; bring it back, put it up and start again - if the die shows a 'dragon' a new monster is added and moves along your way. If you meet one you must escape into the magic wood. You still may roll the die, but only you can escape if the die shows a 'sun'. Anyone who throws a sun (let you leap over dragons and define a number between 1-5, too) can dedicate his/her turn to someone else.

If all 5 dragons are out and block your way team has lost the game.

item.description:
Noms is a four-player Whist-like card game with bidding, in which the bidder's partner is chosen by calling a card, and the identity of the partner remains secret until the called card is played. A standard 52 card pack is used.

Deal
Any player may deal first, and the turn to deal passes to the left after each hand. The cards are not shuffled between deals: the dealer simply gathers the cards from the previous hand, stacking the tricks together, cuts the pack and starts dealing. The deal will result in everyone having a hand of 13 cards.

Bidding
Bids are an undertaking to win at least the stated number of tricks with the help of a partner chosen by nominating a card. The bidder will choose the trump suit but the bids do not mention a suit, only the number of tricks.

Play
The highest bidder leads to the first trick, naming the trump suit and the called card. The identity of the partner is definitively revealed only when the called card is played, though it may be guessed earlier because the partner will try to play cards that will help the bidder.

Scoring
The bid succeeds if the bidder together with the holder of the nominated card win at least as many tricks as the number that was bid. In this case they each score the amount of the bid. If the bidder and partner fail to win enough tricks between them, the other two players score the amount of the bid.

A separate cumulative score is kept for each player and the game can continue until someone reaches the agreed target score, typically 101. The player with most points then wins.

name.value: Ravensburger Spiele Minis: Such Die Affen

item.description:
"Spiele Minis" is a series of small surprise boxes (i.e., you don't know what you get) from Ravensburger. They are meant to be carry-on or gifts, suitable for children ("Mitbringspiel"). Some of the cubes contain actual games, others contain magic tricks, puzzles etc.

This is a game similar to Mastermind but smaller. Each player receives a screen, 3 monkeys (red, blue, yellow) and a board with 6 spaces from 1 to 6.

Each round a player will hide his monkeys (in spaces 1 to 6) while the other tries to guess their location. For that the second player will place her monkeys where she thinks player 1 has his and reveal her board. Player 1 then has to say how many monkeys are in the right position and so on until she gets it right. Then the roles will be exchanged. The player that guesses the right combination in the fewest tries will be the winner.

"Spiele Minis" is a series of small surprise boxes (i.e., you don't know what you get) from Ravensburger. They are meant to be carry-on or gifts, suitable for children ("Mitbringspiel"). Some of the cubes contain actual games, others contain magic tricks, puzzles etc.

The object of the game is to win as many Word cards as possible.

Each round a player will reveal one of the cards (that are placed on the table) and spin the roulette. Then all players will try to say a word that starts with the letter indicated by the roulette and that is in the concept shown by the cards. The first player to do so will win the card.

Cards can have the following categories: profession, food, vehicle, drink, country, name, plant, star, animal.

Content: 1 letters roulette, 9 word cards

Black Stories are morbid and mysterious riddles for teenagers and adults. The players try to reconstruct the crime by asking, guessing and fiddling about.

This was published as a special collector's edition with 110 stories, containing the 50 stories from Black Stories, the 50 stories from Black Stories 2 and 10 additional fan made stories.

Kosmiczna misja is a tile placing children's game. The goal of the game is to gather as many space stations on planets as possible.

The active player rolls a die and either starts a new planet or continues to build one of his (maximum two) open ones. If the player wants to add a tile to an old planet, he has to roll on the die more than the number of finished space stations on the planet.

Then, the available tiles are replenished, and the next player takes his turn. The player with most stations at the end wins.

link.value: Egmont Polska "Dobra gra w dobrej cenie" series

item.description:
"Spiele Minis" is a series of small surprise boxes (i.e., you don't know what you get) from Ravensburger. They are meant to be carry-on or gifts, suitable for children ("Mitbringspiel"). Some of the cubes contain actual games, others contain magic tricks, puzzles etc.

Content: 8 big cards, 8 small cards, 1 pawn, 1 die.

The big cards are placed in a circle face up. Small cards are placed in the center face down. In a turn you roll the die and advance the pawn. Then you must try to reveal the small card that matches the picture in the big card where the pawn is. If you do so you can keep the small card. If the small card is already in front of another player you take it from him. If you are the one holding the small card requested, then you win!

"Spiele Minis" is a series of small surprise boxes (i.e., you don't know what you get) from Ravensburger. They are meant to be carry-on or gifts, suitable for children ("Mitbringspiel"). Some of the cubes contain actual games, others contain magic tricks, puzzles etc.

12 numbered cards in 2 colors are placed face down in the table. 
On a turn you must throw 2 dice and then revealed 2 number cards. If the number and colors of the cards match the ones on the dice you receive a triumph chip. Then you place the cards face down again. If they don’t match then the other players in turn try to revealed the corresponding cards.

The game ends when a player gets 2 triumph chips.

"Spiele Minis" is a series of small surprise boxes (i.e., you don't know what you get) from Ravensburger. They are meant to be carry-on or gifts, suitable for children ("Mitbringspiel"). Some of the cubes contain actual games, others contain magic tricks, puzzles etc.

A player holds a cup while the others have a mouse by the tail (they are in the middle of the table touching by their noses). Then the player holding the cup rolls a die and must quickly catch the mouse of the color indicated by de die.

Only the player with the corresponding mouse can move his mouse trying to escape.

If the player holding the cup catches the mouse, they receive a victory point. If not, it is gained by the player owner of the mouse (who will have the cup now).

If another "mouse" moves its owner must move around the table in 4 feet.

The game ends when a player reaches 5 victory points.

"Spiele Minis" is a series of small surprise boxes (i.e., you don't know what you get) from Ravensburger. They are meant to be carry-on or gifts, suitable for children ("Mitbringspiel"). Some of the cubes contain actual games, others contain magic tricks, puzzles etc.

20 pieces of cloth are placed in the middle of the table. Each player has a clothes line.

On your turn you must throw a die and you get a cloth in the corresponding color, which you hang on your clothes line. If no cloths of that color are left then you receive nothing.

If you throw a sun you must take a sunbeam and place it aside (there are 6). If the sun in the die is shining you can chose any cloth from the middle, but if its unhappy you must return one of yours to the middle (or one of an opponent if you don’t have any left).

The game ends when the sixth sunbeam is taken. The player with more cloth on his clothes line wins!

Objective: get rid of your cards
 - acting by turns -
32 cards (8 each green, red, blue, yellow) are shuffled & placed upside down; one card is flipped; active player draws a card;
if there is a matching colour drop both and flip a new one for next player - otherwise keep drawing and keep the non-matching ones in your hand, hidden.

If all cards are gone on the table: use your hand cards; last player with cards in her/his hand loses the game.

In Video Game High School, players take on the role of students from an alternative school where their classwork is all about preparing for careers as professional video gamers. Each student has unique player powers that they will use to their advantage as they select from a limited allotment of actions to train their gaming skills, take on challengers, and set high scores in various video games. The goal of the game is to climb the player ranks and become the top ranked gamer at VGHS.

NOTE: No prior knowledge of the webseries is needed to play the game.

link.value: Video Game High School: Freddie Wong

item.description:
Objective: gain most victory points finding matching cards
 - acting by turns -
there are 64 cards with matching qualities regarding: colour (4), animal (4), mood (4); additionally on each card you see a mathematical symbols like (2 arrow; arrow 3..)
8 cards are placed in a circle, hidden. Active player turns one and follows shown symbol e.g. 3 steps to the right, turns appropiate card and follows shown symbol again. If all cards are turned or ending in a vicius cycle player may take up to 3 cards putting them on her/his hand. Matching cards (animal/mood/colour) can be formed and dropped (victory points depending on number and matching items). Handlimit: 5 cards

Der Bauherr is a strategy and construction board game. In order to achieve the main goal of building a city, you must buy buildings by winning auctions, build and maintain them. Apart from plenty of buildings to construct, there are also orders to process and events to take care of. Der Bauherr was conceived for two players but also works with more.

Nicht komerzielles Stadt-Aufbauspiel mit Strategieelementen.
Building / City simulation.

Objective: gain as many cards (victory points) as possible
 - acting simultaneously -
each player gets a card: 'fully equipped knight'
gamemaster draws a hidden card from the deck (incomplete knights);
first player who names the missing part gets the card

Objective: be the first reaching space 100
 - moving by turns/use 2 dice -
Simple 'Roll and Move' game; ending on a marked space follow instructions glued into the lid

Notes:
Due to confusing background advertising game is also listed as
'Das grosse Autorennen': inside the lid you can find a third title: 'Die Kurve'; likely published during 1950's

>>> ICE COLD ICE HOCKEY IS NOW LIVE ON BOARDGAMEARENA.COM!!!

Ice Cold Ice Hockey is a thinking-man's card game that has been designed to simulate all the excitement of professional ice hockey. An action deck of 64 cards, three rink-cards and comprehensive yet easy-to-understand rules comprise the complete game (although you'll need to supply a small token, disc or coin). The cards serve multiple purposes, including passing, skating, shooting, defense, shot-blocking and goaltending. Experienced players will be able to complete a game in about an hour.

Note that this is NOT just a “draw and play cards (or a take-that!) game.” Card combinations and good decisions are key in ICIH. You’ll always want to keep an Inside Shot card in your hand, for example, in the hope of pairing it up with a Pass or Skate card that leads to an Inside Shot. (Your brain will be working on all cylinders during the entire game, and your play will improve over time as you learn to watch for the appearance of important cards.)

I call the above a “set-up.” Three and even four-card set-ups are possible, and over time you’ll learn what they are. You can also bluff a bit; for example, if you have a surplus of Offensive Zone (OZ) Skate or Pass cards but no Inside Shot card, you can play an OZ card which allows the play of a defensive card to tease one out of your opponent’s hand.

ICIH features realistic shots on goal, scoring and game play. Sometimes you’ll effortlessly set up end-to-end plays while at other times you’ll only be able to dump the puck out of your own defensive zone. You’ll shoot from the point and, after some effort, from close-in. On defense, sometimes you’ll be able to challenge the puck-carrier and sometimes you won’t. Sometimes you’ll have to risk a penalty to stop an opponent’s scoring chance. Loose pucks, blocked shots, breakaways, fighting, momentum, penalties, super-saves – they’re all here in Ice Cold Ice Hockey!

Objective: be the first completing your player board with coloured chips & learning colours.

- Acting by turns -

Choose a playerboard and throw a coloured d6; you may take a corresponding chip and place it upon an appropriate space of your board. If the die shows 'white': chip is up to your choice, with 'black' you must return a chip of your choice.

Player with a complete player-board wins.

If I Ran the Zoo...Con: The Smofcon 3 game is a simulation of organizing a WorldCon event. Players form committees, perform actions, make decisions, and follow through on those decisions through the bidding, planning, and convention phases of the process using a choose-your-own-adventure style situation resolution book. By conserving goodwill, utilizing people, and balancing finances one committee will produce the most successful event and be crowned WonderCon, while the others will bear the label BlunderCon.

Each player gets 4 rockets and a Sputnik. The moves are determined by a color die. The starting spaces are the colored dots on the rockets at the edge of the game board. The Sputnik is the last piece to start. It circles the Earth till the last rocket has arrived on its destination space. The first Player, who gets his rockets on the 4 destination spaces near his starting spaces and lands the Sputnik on earth in the center of the board, wins the game. A rocket, which lands on a space with another rocket on it, capture this rocket and releases it only when it reaches its destination space.

This game was published 1957 (launch of Sputnik 1) or up to a few years later.

Tombalo is a balancing game. Together, the players are building a dam from sticks and logs. Each player starts with a supply of sticks and logs.

Each turn, a player will draw a card, which shows how many sticks he may add to the dam. He then has to place these sticks on top of the existing construction (or on top of the starting pillars, if there is nothing yet). If any sticks drop in to the water, the player gets new sticks from the supply.

The first player to get rid of all his sticks wins the game.

Divinity is a cooperative turn-based card game for 2 to 4 people, in which each player assumes the role of a deity trying to forge the universe as it is eaten away by powerful disasters of mysterious origin. As players work together, the universe either succumbs to the calamities or is saved by the grace of the gods!

The goal of the players in Divinity is to accumulate points by creating various objects in their galaxies. The divine cards are used by players to achieve their goal, while calamity cards are force-played through to game, undermining the players' efforts. Depth is created through the interaction of all these cards, creating new situations every game and requiring players to consider card abilities carefully in order to master the game.

When the game ends, players add all their points together to judge the fate of all they've built. Players must play wisely, as both divine and calamity cards can cause the game to end. Control of both points and when the game ends is critical to success.

Divinity is inspired by cooperative games heavy in strategy and planning, as well as light and chaotic party games. It's made to be quick to set up, easy to learn, but full of endless wonder. Why not try being a god today?

item.description:
2-6 Players build up defenses and toss Zambies around as weapons. Turn all your enemies into Zambie Bosses and be the last Player alive to win.

A simple game, quick to learn and quick to play. The more people you can get to play the more crazy the game becomes. The game revolves around drawing cards that consist of Zambies and Defenses. You use these cards to turn the game in your favor by blocking incoming Zambies, building up your enemies Zambies pools and once maxed, turning them into Zambies Bosses.

The Game doesn't end when you lose, Oh no, there is much more. When your Zambie pool is maxed out at 15, you collect the Zambies in your pool, and now you get to throw those Zambies at other players.

Zambies is a fast paced card game and can take 5 - 30 minutes to play.

Micro Quest is an adventure micro-game consisting of only 30 high quality cards and 30 custom meeples. Players will utilize the Market Economy and Quest Cards to gather the kings forces of highly trained Knights, Thieves, Clerics, and Mages.

Your land is under siege and the king has commanded you and your compatriots to acquire, train, and supply battle ready troops to support the war effort.

In Micro Quest, players compete for the king's favor (aka: victory points) by managing, training, and paying tribute with troops to support the king's army. 
 The game play consists of 3 phases:

1. Market Phase - players vie for control over the available units.

2. Quest Phase - players train their units by completing epic quests, activating powerful skills, and obtaining glory.

3. Tribute Phase - players compete in an all-out battle for the 'King's Favor' and must be careful managing units in order to pay proper tribute to the king.

Welcome to AssassinCon, the annual convention where assassins meet to show off tools and skills and decide who is the best in the world! This year the contenders have decided to take it out of the judge's hands. Do you have what it takes?

AssassinCon uses an interesting hidden movement mechanism to capture the atmosphere of an event in which anybody could be out to get you. A player knows who their assassin is in real life, but not who they are playing in the game. They move around by secretly playing movement cards that are all shuffled together before being read and played.

The goal is to catch your target while evading your assassin. Points are scored for successfully assassinating a player, identifying your would-be killer, or scaring players into making mistakes as a ghost from beyond the grave, so even dead players are still in on the action!

Can you safely navigate the treacherous crowds of the most dangerous AssassinCon yet?

name.value: Question Quest: The Language Card Game

item.description:
From publisher:

Welcome to the world of Question Quest! It's a wondrous place where language learning happens amid adventure, excitement, and strategic gameplay.

Each turn players compete for Crystal Points by asking and answering questions in conversational English. But things get wild when Special Cards like "What's your answer?" and "Tell me more!" enter the mix! The Crystal Rush is on!

Question Quest is a card game for 2-6 players, playable in 20-40 minutes.

Players take turns asking each other questions in English. Players score points by answering questions correctly or by asking questions that their opponents answer incorrectly.

The game ends when the last card is drawn or at the end of the allotted time. The player with the most points is the winner!

item.description:
480 questions (96 cards) are used to become more familiar with the state/region/territory you are living in (Groningen). A die determines the category (5):
language & history; culture & cohabitation; economy & corporate activities; nature, territory & environment; sport & tourism. If you can give a correct answer you get the card; on the back of each card you see a sixth of a map; with a bit of luck you can find matching ones - winner is the first to gather all six parts of the map.

480 questions are used to become more familiar with the state/region/territory you are living in (Friesland). A die determines the category (5):
language & history; culture & cohabitation; economy & corporate activities; nature, territory & environment; sport & tourism. If you can give a correct answer you get the cart; on the back of each cart you see a sixth of a map; with a bit of luck you can find matching ones - winner is the first to gather all six parts of the map.

Objective: be the first to get the permanent majority of votes for the coming election of the mayor - learn more about the city of Potsdam
- moving/acting by turns.

Each player rolls the die, moves according the number, follows instructions of space landed on; buys, if possible and/or (preferable) votes.

"Chance" cards are created with circumstances out of the history of Potsdam. Correct answers give economic advantages.

Voting process about the next mayor: Each owned company corresponds to a number of votes. The results of each voting are kept and the final winner is the first player who reaches the target.

Objective: be the first to get the permanent majority of votes for the coming election of the mayor - learn more about the city of Wolfsburg
- moving/acting by turns.

Each player rolls the die, moves according the number, follows instructions of space landed on; buys, if possible and/or (preferable) votes.

"Chance" cards are created with circumstances out of the history of Wolfsburg. Correct answers give economic advantages.

Voting process about the next mayor: Each owned company corresponds to a number of votes. The results of each voting are kept and the final winner is the first player who reaches the target.

Objective: be the first to get the permanent majority of votes for the coming election of the mayor - learn more about the city of Lüneburg
- moving/acting by turns.

Each player rolls the die, moves according the number, follows instructions of space landed on; buys, if possible and/or (preferable) votes.

"Chance" cards are created with circumstances out of the history of Lüneburg. Correct answers give economic advantages.

Voting process about the next mayor: Each owned company corresponds to a number of votes. The results of each voting are kept and the final winner is the first player who reaches the target.

Objective: be the first to pass finish line 
learn more about flying a glider

- moving by turns/simple 'Roll and Move' game -

Meeples are moved according the die roll;
ending on a red space (20x) follow instructions..

Lepelstronten: Het Bordspel is the board game developed for the 8th anniversary of gaming club Stobbeldeen.

Using dice, players try to move their pawn to a central target as soon as possible. As soon as one of the players succeeds, the target moves, forcing the other players to change direction and try to reach the new location. During the first phase of the game, users can, instead of rolling the dice, choose to buy cards, which can be used during the 2nd phase to move faster or block other players.

The player who doesn't reach the target in time will be penalized. After a predefined number of rounds, the player who has the least penalty wins the game.

Hastings 1066AD is a wargame simulation of the battle fought in 1066AD to determine the future King of England. One player plays the Norman forces under William the Bastard, while the other plays the Saxon forces under King Harold.

Each turn simulates one hour of time, and each unit represents 300-350 infantrymen or Norman knights. One hex is about 50 meters across.

Contents:

 One 11x17” hard-mounted game map
 One sheet of 88 5/8” game counters 
 Two six-sided die
 Rulebook

name.value: The First Battle of the Marne, 1914 AD

item.description:
The First Battle of the Marne, 1914 AD is an operational level game. 
This September battle changed the course of the war. One player (or team) controls the Allies (France and Britain), while the other controls Germany.

Contains:

 11x17" hard-mounted map
 Playing pieces
 Rulebook
 Player Aid Card

You and your fellow explorers have discovered the underground city of Agartha!...and its fabulous gems! Unfortunately, removing the gems has disrupted the integrity of the area, and now the whole city threatens to collapse around you! Your only hope is to work your way through the city and figure out which gems act as the keys to stop the collapse.

But be careful! The more you move throughout the city, the faster it weakens, and the sooner it will collapse...

...and if that wasn't enough! The gems are all cursed! If the you're skilled enough to survive, be sure you have the least cursed gems...or else the consequences will be swift and painful!!!


Players use deductive reasoning to establish which gems were removed from play at the beginning of the game. This is accomplished by strategically moving along a play area composed of tiles that the players may rotate, push, and move between. Rotating and pushing tiles speeds up the end of the game, so it's best to be judicious in how often you do so.

A cooperative game, if the hidden gems are not identified by game's end, then there is no winner. However, if the group does solve the mystery, then the player in possession of the least cursed gems is victorious!

In the Naruto Shippuden Deck-Building Game, you play as Naruto or one of his comrades and confront S-rank criminals such as Orochimaru and members of the Akatsuki as you explore distant lands on your path to becoming the greatest ninja ever! While you begin with only basic abilities, you'll gain allies, earn equipment, build chakra, and master new powerful techniques, with the goal of defeating as many Archenemies as you can.

Naruto Shippuden Deck-Building Game uses Cryptozoic' "Cerebus" deck-building game engine, in which players use Power as the currency to acquire or defeat available cards, but it also introduces Chakra, a new source of energy for your character and many of the cards you play. Will you focus your deck-building on maximizing your Chakra points? Will you try out new innovations in the game such as positive attacks and cards that give you a bonus as soon as you buy them?

item.description:
The kids game that matches delicious foods, and well... Matching.

Kids flip over one card at a time, looking to match type of pretzel, and flavor of pretzel. However, also in the cards are bonuses, that act like a match over-rider, for that extra edge against other players.

Game play lasts around 5 minutes, and teaches children to notice minor details.

In two player, the person with the most matches wins!

The objective of this car race is to be the first player to reach the finish line crossing 100 "steps". The movement of the cars is determined by a number die. On certain spaces on the track a color die is used to decide, if the result of the number die can be used or if the player has to skip the turn.

Published in 1920's-1930's.

Japan during the Meiji period—a closed, isolated, and feudal country—decides to change into a modern westernized state. The Empire sends emissaries to foreign nations, brings technicians and scholars from the west, builds a network of railroads, and achieves an outstandingly fast industrial revolution.

The nation and Emperor count on the support of the Great Four, the big conglomerates that emerge with great power and massive control over the Japanese economy. They are called Zaibatsu, and their influence on the Meiji Emperor and importance on the fate of Japan is incredibly high.

Nippon is an Area Majority Game in which players control Zaibatsu and try to develop their web of power by investing in new industries, improving their technological knowledge, shipping goods to foreign countries or using them to satisfy local needs, and growing their influence and power as they oversee the era of rapid industrialization of Japan.

The foundations of the big Zaibatsu were the traditional silk workshops, but soon the conglomerates diversified their influence and power, building a complex structure of interconnected companies that made them giant players in the world’s new industrial era. Each player takes the reins of one of these big corporations and tries to develop it in order to grow and achieve power.

To win the game, players must carefully choose which types of industry to invest in to get the most influence over the Japanese islands. Every action that is taken helps to forge their own path to new opportunities.

Nippon is a fast-paced economic game with challenging decisions, set during an important time in Japanese history, and when a new great nation is born.

item.description: In MERCS: Conflict each player takes the helm of a mega-corporation in the not too distant future. Players attack and manipulate their opponents through political prowess, cunning espionage, economic acumen, and military might. Rolling the dice and executing unique abilities is only one way to defeat your opponents. In the end, the last MegaCon standing will receive all the glory. Are you willing to accept the promotion to CEO?

item.description:
Papegaaien is a party game where all competitors answer questions simultaneously and get points whenever more than one player gives the same answer.

One round goes as follows:
- a player draws a card containing 7 questions on a subject. These questions usually read: "Name a x that has attribute y"
- the player reads the questions one by one, each time awaiting the other players answers.
- the other players answer the questions out loud. Each time 2 or more players give the same answer at the same moment, those players score a point. The question asking player judges the simultaneous-ness of the answers.

A session exists of 6 rounds, and in each round each player asks questions once. In the end the player with the most points wins.

In Arkwright players run up to four factories in England during the late 18th Century. Your goal is to have the most valuable block of own shares. Thus, you must increase your share value and buy shares from the bank.

To run the factories, you need workers. When hiring Workers, demand is automatically created. But of course you want to replace your expensive workers (wage 2-5) by machines (1). To have more output from your factories you may employ new Workers or improve your factory to the next technical level.

You fix the price for your goods during an action round. To enhance your chances of selling goods, you improve your factories to higher levels, increase the quality and make some sales promotion. The higher these factors, the better are your chances of success - the higher the price, the lower.

Each player has an own set of "action tokens" like "build and modernize factories", "employ new workers", "improve quality" etc. On your turn you place one of those tokens on one of the free spaces in your line of the "Administration board" and pay the according administration costs, ranging from 2 to 10 (odd numbers). Some actions depend on how much you paid, i.e. you may buy more machines with one single action, when you pay more (= use a higher space, which is then blocked for the rest of the round). During the game your actions become more and more effective by new tokens, i.e. allow you to buy 3 machines in a single turn instead of 2, increase quality 2 levels instead of only 1...).

After each round of actions one kind of factories is active and you have to pay for all your workers and machines there, then sell the manufactured products. The value of your shares increases for sold products and best quality.

Goods may also be traded to the colonies by ship - provided you have a contract with the monopoly of the East Indian Company.

After four turns each of the factories has produced and the round ends. Players remove the action tokens from the administration board and reveal an event token. After 5 rounds the player with the most valuable block of shares wins. Neither being to be the one with the most shares nor being the one with the highest share value guarantees victory.

Arkwright allows you to act in different ways. Run all four factories with most possible output, set the focus on only two factories and improve them more than the others can; use shipping to colony or focus on the home market. In any way you have to react to the opponents and their strategy. Enter markets with deficit in supply or give up business where the other players start to push you out. Buy shares when they are cheap and increase the value, or first make money and buy shares later.

To get familiar with the market mechanics you may start with a 120 minutes version "Spinning Jenny", but for those who like full strategy in economic themed games, the 240 minute "Waterframe"-Rules come with more options to improve your factory and use ships.

item.description:
Wuzzits is a super silly matching game where your goal is to find and assemble the Wuzzit monsters with the most points by drawing, discarding and trading cards with other players.

Featuring wild and wacky art that kids absolutely love. Each of the 62 cards is either a top or bottom half of one of the 30 different Wuzzits. The first player to correctly assemble 3 complete Wuzzits (top & bottom) ends the round and then players add up their points based on how many monsters they were able to complete.

item.description:
The King is old. The kingdom is divided and the great Wizard Morcai is mustering an army atop Fire Castle. From every town in the land the call goes out for heroes to take up the quest for the Five Weapons of Power. Ancient artifacts of immense power capable of giving their wielder the power to be...king! You must heed this call but your quest will not be easy. You must leave your home with only a small supply of modest provisions and brave the Overland's dangers as you seek news and information of the Five Weapons of Power. Along the way you will brave harsh weather, get lost in unfamiliar terrain, encounter powerful and sometimes hostile strangers, enter new towns, visit great castles, make loyal friends and do deeds that will make you a legend. And only if you survive all that will you be worthy to vie for one of the Five Weapons of Power.

Journey To The Overland is a solo tabletop role playing game where you assume the role of a lone traveler journeying throughout the Overland in search of Five Weapons of Power. Play begins in your hometown which will be determined by the race you choose for your character – human, dwarf, elf or native Overlander. From there you will determine your character starting characteristics, starting equipment and first daily action. Each day you must select a daily action that will either involve traveling, resting, working, training or visiting towns and castles to obtain news and information with the ultimate goal being to track down one of the five legendary weapons with the power to make you King!

No. Players: 1
Playing Time: 1 hour per session
Complexity: Moderate
Components: miniature figure, game map, character sheet, encounter cards, event cards, weather cards and dice; (miniature figures and dice not provided).

Gameplay in Matchball is straightfoward. Players compete individually or in teams to bounce a ball into a hole, preferably a hole worth more points than any other. You can't bounce a ball just anywhere, however. On your turn, you roll a die that shows either 1, 2 or 3, and you must bounce the ball off the appropriately numbered platform in front of the field of holes.

name.value: Knuckle Sammich: A Kobolds Ate My Baby! Card Game

item.description:
Knuckle Sammich is a small card game, originally made available to Kickstarter backers of KOBOLDS ATE MY BABY! IN COLOR!!! by 9th Level games.

The object of the game is to fill your stomach with all manner of items that kobolds eat...especially babies!!

From the publisher:

YOU ARE LATE FOR LUNCH! By the time that you get to the Kitchens, lunch is nearly over! You and the other slowpokers and lateniks are going to have to make your own, with some KNUCKLE SAMMICHES!

YOU ARE A KOBOLD trying to tooth and claw your way to a full belly by grabbing the last few sandwiches. Along they way, you may just give up the pretense of making sandwiches and eat your friends instead. Watch out for King Torg (ALL HAIL KING TORG!) and maybe you will survive lunch and wind up with a fresh, tasty baby to eat.

KNUCKLE SAMMICH is a fast card game for 2-7 players that involves a little strategy, a little luck, a few cards, and occasionally shouting at the top of your lungs. Great for any age or gamer type. Based on the popular RPG KOBOLDS ATE MY BABY! and featuring the art of JOHN KOVALIC (of Munchkin and Dork Tower and Kobolds Ate My Baby! fame).

Emergence Event is an exciting new competitive space exploration game for 2-4 players. Each player controls a captain who commands their species’ capital ship. With a unique deck of captain cards, individual strengths, and special abilities, each captain offers players a very different game experience.

Players seek to explore and control locations in the galaxy to gain the resources, artifacts, and technology to help them face more difficult encounters later in the game. As players explore the galaxy, and time passes, encounters become more rewarding, but the penalty for failure rises. Players determine the length of the game by how quickly they move through the galaxy, and how well they manage the damage inflicted on them by their travels, or by their fellow captains.

The galaxy offers a variety of encounters where players can control individual locations through the use of six different skills, such as science, diplomacy, or tactics, depending on an individual’s play style and captain’s strengths. Players can also brave open space, random encounters which increase in difficulty as the game progresses, or explore discoveries and uncover many different stories in the game. How well a player does at exploring and controlling the galaxy is reflected in their victory points.

Made up of modular tiles, the galaxy itself, and many of the elements within, is very different each and every time you play Emergence Event, allowing for great replayability and unique challenges with every game.

name.value: L'Aquila e il Leone: La Battaglia di Vicenza, 7 ottobre 1513

item.description: L'Aquila e il Leone - La Battaglia di Vicenza - 7 ottobre 1513 is a wargame for two players that aims to recreate the battle that took place in the areas close to the city of Vicenza between the armies of the League of Cambrai and the Most Serene Republic of Venice. The players pull chits indicating which section of the battle field is activated, with a mechanism somewhat reminiscent of the Commands & Colors system. The units are moved on a game map divided into squares and depicting the battle field, and combat is resolved through the roll of 2 six sided dice. A secondary map provides the Venetian armies with an alternative path through the marshes, allowing them to outflank the opponents. The winner is the player that controls two of the three sections of the battle field.

item.description:
The players start at the snail's shell in the center of the game board. The game is played with 1 color die. The 1st player to roll his own color, begins the game.

On the roll of any color, the meeples advance to the next space of this color. If a player rolls his own color, he may roll again. When a meeple arrives on an occupied space, it throws the other meeple out, back to the snail's shell. There it must start again. From the last space of its color on the track, the meeples advance to the snail's head of its own color, as soon as the player rolls this color. The 1st player to achieve this, wins the game.

A trivia game focusing on Austrian topography. Players draw cards describing towns, popular sights or landmarks, etc. and are then asked to pinpoint them on the game board which is a map of Austria. However, no place names are included on the map.

The map is divided into several zones of varying sizes. Players can try to gain more points by choosing a smaller (thus more concrete) zone, or play it safe, by only choosing a general area (larger zone) for the location in question.

Objective: score as many goals as possible within a given time or
eliminate all opponent's meeples (except goalkeeper)

- acting by turns -

Players try to score by flipping a smooth disc into opponent's goal
 - if a meeple (building a barrier) is hit remove it.

Notes:
Likely published early 1930's

name.value: Durch Oberbayern und Tirol: Ein neues Reisespiel

learn more about Bavaria/Tirol

name.value: Through the Locks to the Golden Gate

item.description: A spin and move game for two players representing ships journeying through the Panama Canal, from the Caribbean Sea to the Pacific Ocean (the Golden Gate being the strait, not the bridge which wasn't built until two decades later).

A game for two players, similar to Chess, but the board is bigger, and there are also a lot more pieces.

Components:
One 13 X 12 squares board(totally 156 squares)
74 pieces in two colours(37 pieces each side)

Pieces are divided in three groups:
- Infantry
- Cavalry and
- Archers

Every player has the following pieces:

- INFANTRY UNITS - 
1 Leader
9 Heavy Infantry
11 Light Infantry
 
 - CAVALRY UNITS -
4 Heavy Cavalry
4 Light Cavalry


- ARCHERS -
4 Infantry Archers
4 Horse Archers
 
The object of game is to capture the enemy Leader. If the Leaders are the only pieces left on board it's a stalemate and the game is ended a draw. If one player cannot move any piece, or cannot move Leader to a safe square, that player loses the game.
Players play one after the other like in chess(black goes first), but they can play not just one, but also two (and in special condition three) moves per turn.

Each player on his turn can move any two pieces he have (but cannot move the same piece twice like a prolonged move). If he plays with a two units of a different type (e.g. one Infantry and one Archer), he can move even the third piece but that piece must belong to remaining unit (e.g. If a player moved one Infantry and one Cavalry, he can also move one Archer).

Player cannot move and take pieces on the same turn. When taking pieces player can do it with only one unit (and so he loses maneuver advantage of playing with more pieces). The only way to take two pieces on the same turn is that you take one piece with either Infantry or Cavalry, and if there was any piece within range of your Archers, you can take that piece as well.

Leader and Heavy Infantry are Invulnerable to Archers, but they cannot move on the square which is targeted by Archer.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

name.value: Silent Victory: U.S. Submarines in the Pacific, 1941-45

item.description:
Silent Victory is a solitaire tactical level game placing you in command of an American submarine during WWII in the Pacific. Your mission is to destroy as much Japanese shipping and as many warships as possible while advancing your crew quality and decorations - all while remembering you have to make it home.

Silent Victory is purposely designed to deliver a brisk yet intensive gaming experience that forces many decisions upon you as you take command of one of the major U.S. Fleet submarine types in service. Patrols will take you to differing parts of the Pacific as time progresses in the war. The most successful commanders will be those that can manage the risks they take while prosecuting as many targets as possible.

The game engine is built upon the successful Hunters design and has proven to be a solid, playable experience. All the major U.S. Fleet boat types are accounted for with every level of detail including period of service, armaments, crew makeup, damage capacity, and more.

Game contents will comprise:

 One ½” full-color counter sheet
 One ¾” wide full-color counter sheet
 Rules booklet with designer's notes
 Five player aid cards, 2-sided
 Submarine patrol logsheet, 2-sided
 Five submarine Display Mats, 2-sided
 Eight Captain Cards
 Two Submarine Patrol Maps
 Submarine Combat Mat
 Three 6-sided, two 10-sided dice, and one 20-sided die
 Boxed

item.description:
Little Dungeon: Turtle Rock is a dungeon crawling card game. Designed to be simple, imaginative and accessible for young children while having a level of fun to captivate tweens, teens, young adults, parents and grandparents.

As you make your way through this dungeon adventure, collect all the treasure you can. You can get loot, weapons, and special cards to help you along the way, but keep an eye out for those monsters! They have a lot of goodies, but they won't give them up without a fight. You can defend against them, attack them or pay them off. If you defeat them, all their treasure is yours! But look out, for when the Shadow Mage makes his appearance the pace really picks up! The player who collects the most loot wins!

item.description:
The Supreme Glorious Leader needs to be pleasured and players, as managers of Leader's pleasure teams, must provide Dear Leader with the entertainment he requires.

Dear Leader is a quick tile game in which players score points by providing Dear Leader with the entertainers he desires, but if Leader is not in the mood for the entertainers you provide, there will be executions!

Players begin each turn by taking turns drafting entertainer tiles from a central market. Using these entertainer tiles, each player creates a team of entertainers and 'sends it off' to Dear Leader. At the end of each turn, Dear Leader selects one of the 5 types of entertainers (Parades, Cinema, Dancers, Clowns, Libation). The entertainers of the type that Leader selected are scored (placed in a score pile) and the entertainers of the incorrect types are executed. Each of the 5 different entertainer types has a special ability and players can sacrifice them to affect scoring or Dear Leader's decision making.

Game ends when there are no more entertainers. Players score a point for each tile in their score pile and bonus points for having many of the same tile type in the score pile.
